rules.natural: The recipe has premium oil as an ingredient or the kitchen produces high quality dish
If the cook achieves consistent results, then the kitchen produces high quality dish
If the cook receives training in advanced techniques, then should the cook follow standard recipe procedure, the cook achieves consistent results
The cook receives training in advanced techniques or the cook learns from a senior chef mentor
The customer complains about the dish or the dish does not fail quality check
If the kitchen passes health inspection, then the kitchen maintains standards or should the recipe not have substitute oil as an ingredient, the recipe needs adjustment
If the kitchen implements safety protocols, then the kitchen passes health inspection
If the kitchen follows cleaning schedule, then the kitchen passes health inspection
If the health inspector visits the kitchen, then the kitchen implements safety protocols or the kitchen follows cleaning schedule
The health inspector visits the kitchen or the owner conducts audit of the kitchen
If the recipe has substitute oil as an ingredient, then the recipe does not have premium oil as an ingredient
If the owner conducts audit of the kitchen, then the kitchen implements safety protocols or the kitchen follows cleaning schedule
Ingredient shortage occurs in the supply chain or the supplier delays delivery of ingredients
If the supplier delays delivery of ingredients, then provided that the recipe does not have substitute oil as an ingredient, the recipe requires adaptation

If the head chef approves alternative approach, then the kitchen implements alternative for the recipe or should ingredient shortage occur in the supply chain, if the recipe does not have substitute oil as an ingredient, the recipe requires adaptation
The customer receives positive review or quality control does not fail for the dish
If the kitchen earns culinary award, then the customer does not receive positive review
If the chef approves modification of the recipe, then the recipe needs adjustment
If the manager authorizes equipment upgrade, then the cook has a backup plan or should the cook use specialty pan equipment, the kitchen produces high quality dish
The manager authorizes equipment upgrade or the supervisor approves equipment upgrade
If the supervisor approves equipment upgrade, then the cook has a backup plan or provided that the cook uses specialty pan equipment, the kitchen produces high quality dish
If it is not the case that learning from a senior chef mentor leads to the cook achieving consistent results when following standard recipe procedure, then the dish fails quality check

If it is not the case that attending workshop on recipe optimization results in the cook achieving consistent results when learning from a senior chef mentor and following standard recipe procedure, then quality control fails for the dish
If following standard recipe procedure does not result in the cook achieving consistent results, then the procedure does not deviate from standard recipe
If the failure of following standard recipe procedure to achieve consistent results does not lead to procedure deviation from standard recipe, then innovation leads to improvement of the recipe

If the failure of following standard recipe procedure to achieve consistent results does not result in procedure deviation from standard recipe, then innovation does not lead to improvement of the recipe
If the recipe does not have substitute oil as an ingredient, then the chef approves modification of the recipe
